title: If you had a truth serum that would make someone tell the truth about you and they would not remember telling you, would you use it? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. What difference would it make? Their truth about me may or may not be correct. Do you not realized how damaging that would be, this truth serum of yours? When I was younger I was bullied and told by many people that I was worthless and I believed them. I was told by my own father that I was an idiot. I was told by teachers and bosses that I would never make it. I am hardly alone in this. Many people have been told by friends, relatives, coworkers, bosses, spouses, classmates, coworkers, strangers and others that they were worthless or ugly or not good enough or many other negative things and this has had a huge impact on those that choose to believe these ‘truths’. I knew a lady on an amateur art site who had hundreds of people tell her how good her art was, yet when one person made a suggestion on how to improve her art, she took that criticism over all the rest and was deeply hurt.

I am not sure I understand the question so my answers may be very off. But I hope that I have not done something so wretched that I would need my life so well guarded. Yes it would be embarrassing even shameful but nothing that other people haven’t done themselves. I just don’t think the truth serum would be anything I would be too ashamed of
